ticket.title: routing and url_for doesn't accept dots in the custom parameters
ticket.original-body:
hi
In rails routes.rb file I have something like this:
@@@ ruby scope '(:locale)', :module => 'website', :locale => /en|pl/ do
root :to => 'shop#index'
scope 'img' do match 's/', :to => 'dynamic_images#index' match 's/:system_user_file_id/:size/:dummy/:test', :to => 'dynamic_images#show_system_user_image' end
end @@@

version.body:
By default all routes have an optional format parameter added to them unless it is already in the route. To allow this to work dynamic segments don't allow periods by default. This can be overridden by using a regexp requirement and turning off format:
@@@ ruby match '/assets/:file', :to => 'assets#show', :file => %r{[^/]+}, :format => false @@@
Adjust the regexp to allow/disallow whatever characters you need. The example allows everything but slash - use /.+/ if you want to match anything.
BTW, this issue has cropped up multiple times - please use the ticket search to see if your issue has already been reported before creating a new ticket.
